Generation V.Black: The leaves on its head are very bitter. Eating one of these leaves is known to refresh a tired body.
Generation V.White: Since they prefer moist, nutrient-rich soil, the areas where Petilil live are known to be good for growing plants.
Generation V.Black 2: The leaves on its head grow right back even if they fall out. These bitter leaves refresh those who eat them.
Generation V.White 2: The leaves on its head grow right back even if they fall out. These bitter leaves refresh those who eat them.

Generation VI.X: The leaves on its head are very bitter. Eating one of these leaves is known to refresh a tired body.
Generation VI.Y: Since they prefer moist, nutrient-rich soil, the areas where Petilil live are known to be good for growing plants.
Generation VI.Omega Ruby: The leaves on its head are very bitter. Eating one of these leaves is known to refresh a tired body.
Generation VI.Alpha Sapphire: Since they prefer moist, nutrient-rich soil, the areas where Petilil live are known to be good for growing plants.

Generation VII.Sun: Although the leaves on its head are bitter enough to cause dizziness, they provide relief from weariness—even more so when boiled.
Generation VII.Moon: By pruning the leaves on its head with regularity, this Pokémon can be grown into a fine plump shape.
Generation VII.Ultra Sun: Some say if you dry the leaves on its head, boil them down, and drink the infusion, your vigor will return, so Petilil is popular with the elderly.
Generation VII.Ultra Moon: They prefer clean water and soil. When the environment they live in turns bad, the whole bunch will up and move to a new area.

Generation VIII.Sword: Petilil appears around sources of clean water. Boiling leaves from this Pokémon's head results in a liquid that's sometimes used as a bug repellent.
Generation VIII.Shield: The deeper the color of a Petilil's leaves, the healthier the Pokémon is. Petilil sometimes make its home in a well-tended field or flowerbed.
Generation VIII.Legends: Arceus: The leaves on its head are highly valued for medicinal purposes. Dry the leaves in the sun, boil them, and then drink the bitter decoction for remarkably effective relief from fatigue.

Generation IX.Scarlet: The leaves on its head grow right back even if they fall out. These bitter leaves refresh those who eat them.
Generation IX.Violet: If the leaves on its head are pruned with regularity, this Pokémon can be grown into a fine plump shape.

Generation V.White: Pinwheel Forest (inner), Lostlorn Forest , Abundant Shrine
Generation V.White 2: Pinwheel Forest (inner), Lostlorn Forest , Castelia City , Abundant Shrine , Victory Road

Generation VI.Omega Ruby: Mirage Forests (west of Route 114, south of Route 132)
Generation VI.Alpha Sapphire: Mirage Forests (west of Route 114, south of Route 132)

Generation VII.Moon: Malie Garden , Melemele Meadow , Poni Meadow , Poni Plains , Ula'ula Meadow
Generation VII.Ultra Moon: Malie Garden , Melemele Meadow , Poni Meadow , Poni Plains , Ula'ula Meadow

Generation VIII.Legends: Arceus: Crimson Mirelands : Holm of Trials , Cottonsedge Prairie , massive mass outbreaks

Generation IX.Violet: South Province: Area Four West Province: Area One Tera Raid Battles ( 1★ )
Generation IX.The Hidden Treasure of Area Zero: Reveler's Road , Kitakami Hall , Mossfell Confluence , Wistful Fields , Paradise Barrens
